Reasoning: **Considering strategy for scoring**

I’m thinking we should aim big to access the shop and earn money. It’s important to consider the boss debuff, especially if there are many spades in an unknown deck. Having access to the shop could give us the chance to make adjustments. With 3,000 chips needed, I believe our scoring method using Photograph and Chad is solid. If played well, we could easily reach 3,000 chips in just a couple of hands.
**Optimizing joker order**

I’m considering how Chad retriggers the joker category after the first scoring of a card. During this, jokers will trigger again in order. I think Photograph should still apply on retriggers since it triggers with the first face card scored. But if Chad is to the left of Photograph, does he trigger first? Actually, since Chad triggers after scoring, I don’t think order matters. Still, to be safe, I’ll set the joker order as Photograph, Hanging Chad, Gift Card, Mail-in Rebate, and Trading Card.
**Analyzing joker interactions**

I’m noticing that the Gift Card provides an independent +10 multiplier, while the Mail-in Rebate gives +50 chips. The Trading Card only activates on discard, but the ordering of independent jokers doesn't affect the additive multipliers. However, Photograph has a multiplicative effect of x2, but it won’t multiply the +10 from the Gift Card since independent jokers apply later. To be safe, I'll rearrange the jokers in the order of Photograph, Chad, Gift Card, Mail-in Rebate, and Trading Card for optimal scoring.
**Deciding on next action**

I’m considering the Mail-in Rebate, which gives +50 chips independently, while Trading Cards only activate on discard. The independent triggers should apply left-to-right, but since there aren’t any multipliers involved, I don't think rearranging is necessary. However, it doesn't hurt to rearrange, and I’d prefer to play the round instead of wasting time. So, I’ll choose to play the round now. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
